alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:44PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches above 7000 feet. Up to 12 inches on highest peaks including Sierra Blanca. Winds gusting as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet County. * WHEN...Now until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow will cause drifting on roadways and near white-out conditions at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
